Package renderer.pipeline

Class BackFaceCulling2

java.lang.Object
renderer.pipeline.BackFaceCulling2
public class BackFaceCulling2 extends Object
This stage is used by the renderer to cull from a Model's List of Primitives any Triangle that is "back facing".

The culling of Triangle primitives needs to be done after the primitive assembly stage. The culling of Face primitives needs to be done before the primitive assembly stage.

This stage also implements a simple version of the "painter's algorithm". When backface culling is turned off, this stage still sorts primitives into separate lists of front and back facing primitives. Then the back facing primitives get put into the model's primitive list ahead of the front facing primitives. This causes all the back facing primitives to be rasterized (painted) first, and then all the front facing primitives get rasterized (or, painted) over the back facing ones. The painter's algorithm helps give the renderer a sense of 3D depth.

For a good explanation of orientation, forward and backward facing polygons, and back face culling, see Chapter 9 of
"Computer Graphics Through OpenGL: From Theory to Experiments," 4th Edition, by Sumanta Guha, Chapman and Hall/CRC, 2022.

That chapter is available online at
https://www.sumantaguha.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/chapter9.pdf

  • Method Details

    • cull

      public static Model cull(Model model, Camera camera)
      Replace the given Model's list of primitives with a new primitive list from which all back facing primitives have been filtered out. Notice that non Face primitives are considered to be not back facing, so they are kept in the primitive list.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose Primitive list is to be culled
      camera - the Scene's Camera with the view volume data
      Returns:
      a Model with culled back faces or the appropriate side of two-sided faces

    • isBackFace

      public static boolean isBackFace(Primitive p, Model model, Camera camera)
      Determine if a Primitive is a Triangle and if that Triangle is backward facing. Whether a Triangle is back facing or not depends on the Model's setting for frontFacingIsCCW.
      Parameters:
      p - Primitive with at least three vertices
      model - Model that p comes from
      camera - the Scene's Camera with the view volume data
      Returns:
      true if p is a back facing Triangle
